title:
Enroll in the SHIP - 
                University Health Services -     Student Affairs - Carnegie Mellon University
description: Health insurance is a requirement at Carnegie Mellon.
main_content:
Open Enrollment Periods
Fall Open Enrollment for all new fall semester students is July 1 - August 22, 2025.
Students must either enroll in the CMU medical SHIP or apply to waive it during this time.  The SHIP coverage period is August 1, 2025 - July 31, 2026.

Open Enrollment Periods
Fall Open Enrollment for all new fall semester students is July 1 - August 22, 2025.
Students must either enroll in the CMU medical SHIP or apply to waive it during this time.  The SHIP coverage period is August 1, 2025 - July 31, 2026.
Enroll in the SHIP
All full-time and part-time degree-seeking Carnegie Mellon students, and their eligible dependents, are
eligible to enrol
l
in the Student Health Insurance Plan (SHIP) during their
Open Enrollment
period.
Students can also enroll in the SHIP, or add eligible dependents to their existing SHIP enrollments, outside of Open Enrollment due to a
Qualifying Life Event
(QLE).
The SHIP coverage period is August 1 - July 31
Optional
dental and vision plans
are available during Open Enrollment or due to a QLE
To enroll during Open Enrollment:
Log into SIO > Campus Life > Health Insurance
Click the Enroll/Waive link
Complete your enrollment and click 'Confirm' to submit
Quick Links
SHIP Premium Rates
SHIP Benefits & Plan Documents
Qualifying Life Event Enrollments
SHIP Open Enrollment
You are eligible to enroll in the SHIP if you are:
A degree-seeking full-time or part-time student.
An eligible dependent of an enrolled student:
Spouse or Domestic Partner
Child
Any person for which the student is their Legal Guardian
Graduating in August:
Eligible to enroll in the medical SHIP for the month of August only. August graduates should email
shinsure@andrew.cmu.edu
in July or August for assistance.
A doctoral student
In Absentia:
Eligbile to enroll only with documentation from their academic department verifying an active relationship with the department, and an estimated graduation date within one year.
A degree-seeking student enrolled in a remote program.
Ineligible for the CMU SHIP
Individuals with access to staff benefits, adjunct professors, visiting scholars/researchers and university consultants may not enroll in the student insurance plans.
CMU employees enrolled in a degree-seeking program will see a health insurance charge on their student account, but are not eligible to enroll in CMU SHIP, nor are they subject to the student insurance mandate. If an insurance charge has been posted to your account please
email us
so we can assist with reversing the fee.
Separation from the University
Students who enroll in the SHIP during their Open Enrollment period, and separate prior to the start of classes, are not eligible to keep their SHIP enrollments. To maintain a SHIP enrollment for the full coverage year, students must remain enrolled at CMU for the first 31 calendar days from the start of classes of their first active semester. Students who separate from the university within the first 31 days of that semester will have their SHIP enrollment(s) terminated the first of the following month.
Qualifying Life Event (QLE) Enrollments
Outside of your Open Enrollment period students can enroll in the SHIP, or add
eligible dependents
to their existing SHIP enrollments, due to a Qualifying Life Event.
Students
have 90 days from the event to submit the required documentation and enrollment(s).
This applies to the student medical, dental and vision plans.
Premium rates are pro-rated, you only pay for the months you, or your dependent, are enrolled.
Qualifying Events & Required Documentation
Loss of coverage on another medical plan (including turning 26):
Letter from an employer or insurance plan verifying loss of coverage date
Or:
Screenshot
from your insurance portal verifying loss of coverage date or that coverage is no longer active
Birth or adoption of child:
Birth Certificate
Birth Record
Or:
Adoption Certificate
Marriage/Domestic Partner Registration or
arrival of spouse and/or dependent to U.S.:
Marriage Certificate
CMU
Domestic Partnership Registration
Or:
I-94 verifying arrival date in the U.S.
If you are in need of a QLE enrollment, please
contact the Student Health Insurance Team
for assistance.
